enrich_metadata.label: San Francisco
enrich_metadata.abstract: San Francisco (/sæn frənˈsɪskoʊ/), officially the City and County of San Francisco, is the cultural, commercial, and financial center of Northern California and the only consolidated city-county in California. San Francisco encompasses a land area of about 46.9 square miles (121 km2) on the northern end of the San Francisco Peninsula, which makes it the smallest county in the state. It has a density of about 18,187 people per square mile (7,022 people per km2), making it the most densely settled large city (population greater than 200,000) in the state of California and the second-most densely populated major city in the United States after New York City. San Francisco is the fourth-most populous city in California, after Los Angeles, San Diego and San Jose, and the 13th-most populous city in the United States—with a Census-estimated 2014 population of 852,469. The city and its surrounding areas are known as the San Francisco Bay Area, and are a part of the larger OMB designated San Jose-San Francisco-Oakland combined statistical area, the fifth most populous in the nation with an estimated population of 8.6 million. San Francisco (Spanish for Saint Francis) was founded on June 29, 1776, when colonists from Spain established Presidio of San Francisco at the Golden Gate and Mission San Francisco de Asís named for St. Francis of Assisi a few miles away. The California Gold Rush of 1849 brought rapid growth, making it the largest city on the West Coast at the time. San Francisco became a consolidated city-county in 1856.After three-quarters of the city was destroyed by the 1906 earthquake and fire, San Francisco was quickly rebuilt, hosting the Panama-Pacific International Exposition nine years later. In World War II, San Francisco was the port of embarkation for service members shipping out to the Pacific Theater. After the war, the confluence of returning servicemen, massive immigration, liberalizing attitudes, along with the rise of the "hippie" counterculture, the Sexual Revolution, the Peace Movement growing from opposition to United States involvement in the Vietnam War, and other factors led to the Summer of Love and the gay rights movement, cementing San Francisco as a center of liberal activism in the United States. Politically, the city votes strongly along liberal Democratic Party lines. San Francisco is a popular tourist destination, known for its cool summers, fog, steep rolling hills, eclectic mix of architecture, and landmarks including the Golden Gate Bridge, cable cars, the former Alcatraz Federal Penitentiary, Fisherman's Wharf, and its Chinatown district. San Francisco is also the headquarters of five major banking institutions and various other companies such as Levi Strauss & Co., Gap Inc., Salesforce.com, Dropbox, Reddit, Square, Inc., Dolby, Airbnb, Weebly, Pacific Gas and Electric Company, Yelp, Pinterest, Twitter, Uber, Mozilla, Wikimedia Foundation, and Craigslist. It has several nicknames, including "The City by the Bay", "Fog City", "San Fran", and "Frisco", as well as older ones like "The City that Knows How", "Baghdad by the Bay", and "The Paris of the West". As of 2015, San Francisco was ranked high on world livability rankings.

attraction_reviewComments: We visited here and saw 'Sully' the film. The theatre just has one screen and so a limited number of showings a day. Ticket prices were pretty good (can only compare to UK cinema... read more
This was a Christmas present for my husband, so it wasn't my idea. I was pleasantly surprised and had a good time. Theatre is small, but it was perfect for this event.
A wonderful place - historic, with a unique atmosphere, harkening back to a glamorous past yet modernized for a wonderful cinema experience. If there's a movie I'm at all... read more
The Arlington is a wonderful old theater with character and charm. You may just forget what you came to see and find yourself gazing at the... well go and see!
it is very old and historic the inside is beautifully painted with small balconies that are fake but, a nice touch. the ceiling is painted black with twinkling small stars. it... read more
There isn't another theater in the country (to my knowledge) with a gorgeous Spanish Colonial tiled entry foyer complete with fountains. Just seeing that transports you to the... read more
Worth a visit to see an event. As the lights dim, the stars come out on the ceiling. Beautiful theater.
Went to the Arlington Theater to see Magic Johnson's inspirational speech. Beautiful, nostalgic theater with a Mexican Village theme along the side walls. Could have used some... read more

enrich_metadata.label: Civic Center, Bakersfield
enrich_metadata.abstract: Civic Center is a district in Downtown Bakersfield, California. It is the center of government for the City of Bakersfield and the County of Kern, containing a collection of buildings used by the city, county, state, and federal governments. The district also contains all of downtown's sporting complexes. It also has the Rabobank Theater and Convention Center, which is the largest theater and convention facilities in the city.

enrich_metadata.label: Fremont, California
enrich_metadata.mention_address: Fremont, Alameda County, California, United States of America
enrich_metadata.abstract: Fremont /ˈfriːmɒnt/ is a city in Alameda County, California. It was incorporated on January 23, 1956, from the merger of five smaller communities: Centerville, Niles, Irvington, Mission San Jose, and Warm Springs. The city is named after American explorer John Charles Frémont, "the Great Pathfinder." Located in the southeast section of the San Francisco Bay Area in the East Bay region primarily, Fremont has a population of around 220,000. It is the fourth most populous city in the San Francisco Bay Area, and the largest suburb in the metropolis. It is the closest East Bay city to Silicon Valley, and is thus sometimes associated with it. The area consisting of Fremont, Newark (an enclave of Fremont), and Union City (formed from the communities of Alvarado and Decoto), is now known as the Tri-City Area. Fremont is home to the largest population of Afghan Americans in the United States.
enrich_metadata.subject: http://dbpedia.org/resource/Fremont,_California

attraction_reviewComments: Wonderful views of the ocean, cliffs, rocks, distant mountains. However, why not park the car and walk on the boardwalk or the beach? The boardwalk is well maintained, there are... read more
Walk the wooden trail and meander onto the beach to see the tidepools and wildlife. You may even be lucky enough to see a sealion, whale or otter family. The view of the Pacific... read more
This is a wonderful easy walk along the coast, flat, handicapped accessible, dog friendly (on leash).
I loved walking along Moostone Drive - walkways to beach, a park to sit and enjoy the ocean or have lunch and watch the wildlife and the sealife.
A meandering boardwalk with benches to sit on from time to time and a fun time looking for moonstones on the beach. Enjoyed the park at the north end of Moonstone Drive. Picnic... read more
Walk the boardwalk and watch the sun gone down or just sit and do nothing.. Great place.
This is a great area with many small hotels and a couple of restaurants. The boardwalk is really nice and accessibility is not an issue. It is above the beach which is down the... read more
Early morning walks or better the long walk during sunsets is incredible. Wooden walkways and many benches to sit awhile to enjoy the views.
Ahh, the air, the sunsets, the early morning walks, the boardwalk, the waves crashing against the rocks. Ahhhh. Pure joy
We always stay at the Sand Pebbles Inn because it is on Moonstone Drive right across from the ocean. I love to walk on the boardwalk and listen to the waves at night.
We loved walking along with boardwalk. It is well maintained and covers a long path on the cliffs above the beautiful beach. The views are fantastic. We saw many seabirds, as well... read more
I hope to one day return and spend some days to explore this area more.
Moonstone Drive is one of our favorite places to walk. It is a beautiful walk along a path overlooking the ocean. Breathtaking!
Weather was so cool and the views of the coast were great. There are not buildings on the beach side so you have an unobstructed view. The seaweed can be a little bit smelly.
Our visit to Cambria, California would not be complete unless we visited the Moonstone area. Moonstone Drive is just off Highway 1 and travels along the scenic coastline. We... read more
Whenever we come to Cambria this is the ONLY spot we stay. We've stayed in quite a few of the hotels, favoring some over the others. We've ALWAYS enjoyed our visit! The weather... read more
We love this walk along the ocean bluffs. Very nice and well-kept boardwalk. You hardly even notice the traffic. The ground squirrels are fun to watch. Always beging for some... read more
Romantic, authentic, even when it is busy...we spent two days of our honeymoon at the Sea Otter Inn 18 years ago and it was incredibly romantic.. of course, it was also a lot less... read more
Not prepared for sand on you feet or in your shoes? Try walking the boardwalk along the ocean. All ages seem to enjoy the walk and plenty of photo opportunities help.
Nice boardwalk along the ridge gives you a pretty view of the coast, sometimes you will even see a seal or two (or hear them honking away). Great for walking your dog or just... read more
There are lots of small hotels right along Moonstone Dr. with beautiful views of the pacific ocean and the sunsets. Its a short drive maybe a mile. There are beach access along... read more
clean and quiet in a neighborhood. Felt very safe. Did not see many young people, not much to do for a younger crowd, but, that was a bonus for us.
A drive up (or down) Moonstone Beach Drive is beautiful, not only for the views of the ocean but also for the residences. Near the park you will find that the waterline lives up... read more
Easy stroll, walkway goes for a fair way and then you can off road it if you wish (we did). Beautiful scenery. Worth a detour for if you're in the area. Great for couples... read more
About a 5-10 minute drive or 20-30 minute walk from the town of Cambria - it is a cove - maybe about a mile or so long - ocean on one side - and houses/hotels and 2 restaurants on... read more
Right across the street from most motels on Moonstone Drive is a great boardwalk. There are places to sit and watch the ocean and areas to go to the beach. Always a great sunset.
definitely worth detouring off the PCH to visit here. Lots of cool places to pull over and see. Drive slow...There are a lot of people jay walking
If you must stay in Cambria, this wood plank walkway provides a nice place to stroll overlooking the beach and coastline. I just wish it were lighted because there are no... read more
There s a beautiful walk that runs along side Moonstone Drive. It is an easy walk with a beautiful view. There are places to stop and rest or to watch the sunset. It is my... read more
Okay, it was raining and super cold, but this made the whole drive even more beautiful. We enjoyed a break in the park
A very scenic drive and walking trails. We love the ocean. Limited places to stop and park. One main restaurant but it was excellent plenty of great bed and breakfast choices.
Gorgeous, gorgeous walk! Because of my knee problem, I set 5,000 as my goal on my Fitbit device. My husband and I went on this Walk on Moonstone Drive, with the ocean to look at... read more
Nice peaceful walk, gorgeous view and perfect photo op location. Seagulls, Pacific seals to photo. Close to motels and restaurants. Pleasant walk to town.
Great place for an easy walk beside the ocean. The path is a boardwalk most of the way, with a couple of places for beach access. Fresh air, and wonderful spicy smell on the... read more
Enjoy a stroll along the board walk along the edge of a short bluff about the beach. There are benches along the way to sit and enjoy the view.
What an unexpected pleasure. Walking along the board walk by the sea shore. Even at the busiest time of year it is not to busy and not commercial at all. No ferris wheels... read more
It's just a nice drive along the coast. There is also a boardwalk that is about one and one-half mile.
Great walk on the ocean!!! Right across the street I had the best Chappino I've ever had!!! You know with no pasta!! I forget the name of the place cuz it's been so long but it... read more
This is a great walkway that we used every day. At Twilight we would use it to go see the seals. It is used by both the locals and visitors -- so we met many great people.
This place was absolutely beautiful to walk through who doesn't want to be next to an ocean . The night walk was most exceptional would do it again in a heartbeat.
This walkway is right on the beach and there are a few places to access the sand from it. It's an easy stroll and very pleasant. Parking is easy along the route.
There are just a million things to do here! Walk, sit, take pictures, drink wine, watch the waves, close your eyes, drink coffee (if you're there in the morning), greet the nice... read more
Moonstone Drive is quite beautiful with no crowds, impressive beaches, and reasonably priced accommodations.
We took this drive to take a break from the Highway. There are lots of places to pull off, in addition to the Moonstone Beach (reviewed separately). There is also a small part... read more
